byline.contributor: Bhadra Sharma contributed reporting from Katmandu.

abstract: Semblance of normalcy returns to Kathmandu, Nepal, as residents return home, businesses reopen and electricity is restored week after devastating earthquake there; small villages destroyed by quake face longer recovery.
lead_paragraph: A growing number of residents were packing up their tents, checking out of hospitals and preparing for the workweek in Nepal’s capital.

headline.main: Hints of Normalcy in Katmandu, but Rebuilding Lies Ahead
headline.print_headline: Hints of Normalcy Return to Nepal’s Capital, but Recovery Looms

snippet: A growing number of residents were packing up their tents, checking out of hospitals and preparing for the workweek in Nepal’s capital.
